directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: skip

inputFields.description:
This is the CSM that will be assigned to take care of the organization.
They are also the person the welcome email is sent from.

inputFields.description: If this is true, then it will NOT create the Organization but it will validate the arguments and pass back a fake ID and UID. Defaults to TRUE.

inputFields.description:
This is an optional person that will have the same permissions as an
account owner. They are usually a person that sets up the locations
in leu of the account owner. This is usually used for big organizations.
inputFields.name: implementationContact

inputFields.description: This defines how many locations the organization can have
inputFields.name: locationLimit

inputFields.description: The products that will be given to the organization
inputFields.name: products

types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a date and time in the UTC
timezone. The DateTime appears in a JSON response as an ISO8601 formatted
string, including UTC timezone ("Z"). The parsed date and time string will
be converted to UTC if there is an offset.
types.name: DateTime

types.description:
The `Json` scalar type represents arbitrary json string data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The Json type is most often used to represent a free-form
human-readable json string.
types.name: JsonSnakeCase

types.description: The email scalar type validates the email format.
types.name: Email

types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.
types.name: ID

types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.
Int can represent values between `-(2^53 - 1)` and `2^53 - 1` since it is
represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specified
by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).
types.name: Int

types.description:
The `Json` scalar type represents arbitrary json string data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The Json type is most often used to represent a free-form
human-readable json string.
types.name: Json

fields.description:
"Account Structure" is an umbrella term to refer to Organizations, Locations,
Users, and the products they're given.

This will do a one-way sync of the account structure in an idempotent way.
Salesforce uses this to allow it to just say, "This is how I want things in
the end" and Anakin does its best to reach out to the various microservices
(mostly Review Rocket) to bring the system into sync with that state. After it's
done it will return the result of those different operations (if they failed or not).
fields.name: syncAccountStructure

The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.
types.name: String

inputFields.description: This the primary person that will become an owner of the organization

types.description:
The `UUID` scalar type represents UUID compliant string data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The UUID type is most often used to represent unique
human-readable ID strings.
